title: Integrated Partner Marketing Senior Associate
content:
SeatGeek believes live events are powerful experiences that unite humans. With our technological savvy and fan-first attitude we’re simplifying and modernizing the ticketing industry. 
By catering to both consumers and enterprises, we’re powering a new, open entertainment ecosystem where fans have effortless access to experiences, and teams, venues, and shows have seamless access to their audiences. Because everyone should expect more from ticketing.
As a Senior Associate on the Integrated Partner Marketing team, you’ll work cross-functionally across SeatGeek to ideate, lead, and manage revenue-generating marketing initiatives across our integrated partners like MLB, NFL, College Football, the Cleveland Cavaliers and Florida Panthers. You'll also work to ensure our partners feel the power of the marketing value we provide by strategically presenting and meeting with our partners directly. This role will partner closely with the customer retention marketing, growth marketing, sponsorship, creative, and account management teams to ensure our marketing efforts are seamlessly integrated and executed. Simultaneously you will also work externally to share key marketing wins with our partners. Reporting to the Manager, Integrated & Partner Marketing Manager, you’ll help coordinate and manage end-to-end marketing initiatives across the business while providing thought leadership and best practices.
What you'll do

Work cross-functionally to bring strategic marketing plans and initiatives to life across all channels, with a focus on revenue generation and integrated partnerships
Collaborate with external facing teams at SeatGeek to identify needs across our integrated partnerships and work cross-functionally within SeatGeek to organize marketing campaigns and solutions to meet those needs
Building and maintaining marketing project calendars, leading the development of integrated channel plans, and cascading go-live dates and shifts to timing to cross-functional teams in a timely manner
Build and deliver detailed marketing wrap-reports for high demand tour stops at our partner venues aimed at providing a snapshot of the team’s efforts, impact and key insights from SeatGeek
Work with the sales team to develop and deliver pre-sales pitch presentations to high-value prospects  
Compile and interpret analytics reporting across owned projects 
Learn as much as possible about the ticketing, sports, and entertainment industry

What you have

Bachelor's degree and 4-6 years of experience in integrated marketing strategy with preferred additional experience in a client-facing role 
Experience owning multiple relationships or projects at once and delivering success across them all
Expert communication and collaboration skills
Exceptional data analysis skills, especially utilizing Business intelligence software (Tableau, Yellowfin, Looker, etc.) and spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets)
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders and partners alike to deliver successful outcomes 
A passion for the sports and entertainment space and an eagerness to partner with venues and promoters to maximize revenue for their events
Understanding of core marketing channels such as CRM, SEM, SEO, Social and Influencer
Proven ability to lead projects from ideation to implementation to analysis, particularly when initial idea/problem may be ambiguous
 

Perks

Equity stake
Flexible work environment, allowing you to work as many days a week in the office as you’d like or 100% remotely
A WFH stipend to support your home office setup
Flexible PTO
Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave
401(k) matching program
Health, vision, dental, and life insurance
Annual subscriptions to Headspace, Ginger.io, and One Medical 
$120 a month to spend on tickets to live events
Annual subscription to Spotify, Apple Music, or Amazon music

 

The salary range for this role is $75,000-$115,000. Actual compensation packages within that range are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, certifications, and specific location.
SeatGeek is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. As an equal opportunities employer, we recognize that diversity is a positive attribute and we welcome the differences and benefits that a diverse culture brings. Come join us!
#LI-Remote

demographic_questions.description:
We love live events because they bring people of all walks together. We strive to bring the same feeling of connectedness into our own organization by embracing people of all backgrounds because we understand that different ideas and perspectives power the innovation that is key to our success.

In order to better understand our efforts in this regard, we invite applicants to self-identify as to their gender, sexual orientation, race/ethnicity, and veteran status. Completion of this form is entirely voluntary and declining to provide this information will not subject you to adverse treatment. Any information that you do provide will be maintained confidentially and will not be shared with hiring managers.

SeatGeek is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, creed, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, military or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. You are being given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us measure our own diversity and inclusion efforts and to comply with applicable federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity record-keeping and reporting obligations.
